History

Where Phalanx Started

Phalanx began as a physical card-combat concept explored through notebook sketches and tabletop prototypes in 2022. Early design work focused on rows, column pressure, and suit-driven combat identity.

Historical archives on this page are for project history only. Canonical current rules remain in the primary repository documentation.

Evolution Timeline

  • July 9, 2022: initial commit in the primary Phalanx repository.
  • July 10-16, 2022: notebook scans, tools photos, suit notes, deployment and gameplay basics documented.
  • July 11, 2022: project renamed from Panoplia to Phalanx.
  • July-August 2022: legacy Ruby implementation explored battle logic and test-driven combat behavior.
  • February 9-11, 2026: TypeScript monorepo and formal draft rules established with engine/test mapping.
  • Current: rules and digital head-to-head implementation continue to evolve.

Archived Technical Artifacts

To preserve implementation history, selected source artifacts are copied under:

  • assets/history/primary/resources/ (early scratch/resource files)
  • assets/history/legacy/code/ (legacy Ruby battle and spec files)

These archives are historical references and should not be treated as current gameplay authority.

Phalanx is a tactical two-player card duel playable with standard suited playing cards.
